title: Leaning
lyrics:
I don't want the doctor to know that I don't wanna heal
[?] but there's nothing to see here
You can't fix with Tylenol, a hundred dollar bill
And all I need is time to forget all this
I pulled a photo up from back in our youth
It looked a lot like me and it felt a lot like you

There ain't no one who can stop the change

We're crying out, maybe that's the end



'Cause you've been leaning

Leaning on the weight of my love

Now you're sinking, sinking like a house in the mud

And all I had was never enough



I don't want the doctor to know that I know how to fix

Or the reasons why I'm hung up on this

I already know what's wrong, I need to get more sleep

Can I be next to you for a couple weeks?



'Cause you've been leaning

Leaning on the weight of my love

Now you're sinking, sinking like a house in the mud

And all I had was never enough



You need Jesus now, he can fix you up

And live in his castle, ride in his truck

He's got clouds for wheels

And you ride around town, town, town, town



You've been leaning

Leaning on the weight of my love

Now you're sinking, sinking like a house in the mud

And all I had was never enough
